definitions.definition: the practice of showing respect for God or a god, by saying prayers, singing with others, etc.; a ceremony for this

examples.text: morning/evening worship *(= a church service in the morning/evening)*
The tradition of ancestor worship stretches back thousands of years.
Fifteen per cent of the population attend a place of worship.
Our worship today is led by the Reverend John Parker.
Under the new regime, all religions enjoy freedom of worship.
the use of music in worship

definitions.definition: a strong feeling of love and respect for somebody/something

examples.text: What she feels for him is akin to worship.

definitions.definition: a polite way of addressing or referring to a magistrate or mayor

wordOrigin: Old English weorthscipe ‘worthiness, acknowledgement of worth’ (see worth, -ship).
